5B4A67D4144A43E6BDAF473E00B7CB5F.description: Appreciation: Recognizing beauty, goodness, and truth in dance can be developed by understanding the complexity and richness of great works of dance, the artists who create and perform them, and the historical and cultural contexts from which they originate

BB0A474FB8D04E3CA4E0FC53BD165B21.description: Dance ideas can be expressed using body shapes of different sizes, levels, and positions locomotor and nonlocomotor movements stillness and balance various body parts moving individually or together at the same time pathways, levels, speed, force, and direction music props costumes Inspiration for a dance idea can come from other dancers and dances stories artworks and images imagination the environment props music or sounds costumes

moving the body in
relation to space,

Shapes can be
created with the body,

ED1986D1FB674A06A21562FA65724443.description: The body is unique to each individual.

3FF4356AB5204BC897D1BCE85D15F72F.description: Music and props can inspire movement

F043092599334306B5AAAADEEE533833.description: Movements can include facial expressions, posture, and gestures

84264308CB454AA3845C0F2BFF540C2E.description: Dancers can choose how to move the body in order to communicate an idea

7E5B00DB68AB49FA94520560CA35381D.description: Movement can communicate thoughts, feelings, and ideas

2F9B23C55CBB4FE8BAA75F362D35105B.description: Movement speed can be fast or slow.

4635676C59EE4445AD70ACA107E7D14E.description: Counting beats aloud can help direct when a movement should begin and end

42758DAD984547918049757E566CACE1.description: Movement can occur to a steady beat.

243C8AD946E54AA9976A5BD152C0C6C6.description: The body can travel from one place to another (locomotor).

70124147382C447C8F075C32AFC69090.description: Movement can occur in personal space (self space) or in shared space (general space).

2B919B8C88DA43F0AB52515F6E4DC8AB.description: Shapes can be created with the body by adjusting levels, including high and low size, including small and big position of body parts

FB6B5FA20205441D9291790A69719AFF.description: Formations for a dance can incorporate many bodies to create shapes, including circles and lines.

854DD1C310FA465D986C3D2EF2CD5FD8.description: Bodies can create shapes while moving or still.

B27E82E9D87E44DDA43ECAB2E76EEDBC.description: Safe dance practices for the body can include warm-up and cooldown activities moving through general space with an awareness for self and others

5E07DFC36B8546EB8E0CECE001A6FD92.description: Body, as an element of dance, includes body parts relationships to space, people, and objects balance Different body parts can be used to balance the body.

F46F0EC47C364720BCC1F279245868DF.description: Students examine how the body can influence movement in dance.

2097994142BB48839ABD3DFC88896A80.description: Foundational Elements and Principles: Dance literacy is developed through knowledge and application of foundational elements and principles.
